### About

KOE focuses on the form of education: so-called Open Educational Materials (OEM). OEM can be defined as materials that are shared conform the [FAIR principles](https://www.uu.nl/en/research/open-science/tracks/fair-data-and-software). 

See [this presentation](https://www.gerkovink.com/koe/koe.html) for a brief introduction of the KOE project.

### Examples

Some examples of Open Educational Materials (OEM) developed at the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences, Utrecht University <a href="https://uu.nl"><img src="/logo.png" width="16px"/></a>:

- [Youtube lectures under open licence](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1x3HW1RczAo)
- Materials for [Supervised Learning and Visualization](https://github.com/gerkovink/slv) and the corresponding [course page](https://www.gerkovink.com/slv)
- Materials for [Markup Languages and Reproducible Programming in Statistics](https://github.com/gerkovink/markup) and the corresponding [course page](https://www.gerkovink.com/markup) and [student repository](https://github.com/gerkovink/markup2021)
- [Knowledge clips M&S](https://www.youtube.com/c/MethodologyStatisticsFSWUU)
- Course page for [Theory Construction and Statistical Modeling](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/TCSM/)
- Course page for [Battling the curse of dimensionality](https://uudav.nl)
- Course page for [Applied Data Analysis and Visualization](https://adav-course-2021.netlify.app/)
- Youtube lectures for [Practicum Data Analyse](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4jJSm4m9UVc&list=PLOQIOFZl7uYaFtuWgEVIeN97zei5ok5G5)
